title: Matrix Me - AI Personality Quiz (4-Axis System)
description: Discover your AI usage personality type through 4-axis analysis. D(Dependency) - E(Exploration) - T(Trust) - C(Control) system.

questions.question:
It's Friday night, you're ordering pizza online, but there are 30 different options!
You're starving, the place closes at 11 PM, and it's already 10:30 PM.
Decision paralysis is real. What's your move?

answers.text: Go with something I've ordered before - trust my past choices
Quickly read descriptions and pick based on ingredients I like
"Hey AI, what's good at this pizza place?" - use as a starting point
Ask AI to recommend based on my preferences and dietary needs
"AI, just order me something good!" - complete delegation

questions.question:
You have an important presentation at 9 AM tomorrow,
and you've literally done ZERO preparation.
It's 2 AM, you're holding a coffee, thinking "How did I get here?"
What's your survival strategy?

answers.text: "No shortcuts!" - pull an all-nighter and do it properly myself
Research online, gather materials, and build it step by step
Ask AI for an outline, then I'll flesh it out with my own content
Have AI create 70%, then I'll customize the remaining 30%
"AI, please save my career" - generate the whole thing

questions.question:
Your friend proposes a challenge:
"Let's go 24 hours without using any AI tools!"
Your honest first reaction is?

answers.text: "Easy! I barely use that stuff anyway" - accept confidently
"Might be inconvenient, but doable" - slight concern
"Hmm, today might be rough" - starting to worry
"Wait, really? But I have work to do!" - panic mode activated
"That's impossible! How am I supposed to function?!" - absolute refusal

questions.question:
You need to send an important message (job application, business inquiry, etc.)
and you've been staring at a blank screen for 30 minutes.
Even "Hello" feels wrong. What do you do?

answers.text: Take a deep breath and write it from the heart - authenticity wins
Look up examples online and adapt them to my situation
Ask AI for suggestions, then rewrite it in my own voice
Get AI to write a few options and pick the best one
Let AI craft the perfect message and send it as-is

questions.question:
You just moved to a new area and need to find a good place for dinner tonight.
You don't know anyone locally and all the streets look the same.
Your approach?

answers.text: Walk around and see which places look busy and inviting
Check Google Maps reviews and ratings carefully
Ask AI for recommendations and then research the top suggestions
Get AI recommendations and head to the highest-rated option
"AI, find me the closest great restaurant with directions"

questions.question:
You wake up to notifications everywhere: "GPT-5 is here!"
Comments are going wild with "This changes everything!"
and "AI revolution is real!" Your reaction?

answers.text: "Cool story, not my problem" - swipe away and check other news
"Interesting, maybe I'll check it out later if I need it"
"Hmm, what's different about this one?" - click to read more
"I NEED to try this right now!" - immediately start testing
Already signed up for beta access months ago

questions.question:
Your friend excitedly shows you their phone:
"Dude, this AI app is insane! Just take a photo
and it tells you everything about what you're looking at!"
What's your response?

answers.text: "That's... nice. I'm good with what I have" - politely uninterested
"Interesting tech, but isn't this just Google Lens?" - cautiously skeptical
"Show me how it works" - curious but not rushing to download
"Send me the link! I want to try this" - immediate download
"Oh, that one? Yeah, I've been using it for months. Try this one instead..."

questions.question:
You're reviewing your monthly expenses and realize
your AI tool subscriptions add up to... more than you expected.
Your budget reaction?

answers.text: $0 - I stick to free versions or don't use AI tools
Under $15 - just one essential subscription
$20-40 - a few carefully selected tools
$50-80 - I need variety for different tasks
$100+ - I prefer not to look at the exact number...

questions.question:
Honestly counting ALL AI-related apps on your phone
(ChatGPT, translation apps, photo editors with AI, etc.),
how many do you have?

answers.text: Maybe 1-2, if any - I don't really seek these out
3-4 basic ones - just the essentials
5-8 apps - different tools for different purposes
10-15 apps - I like having options
20+ apps - I need a separate folder (or three)

questions.question:
It's Saturday afternoon, you're home with no specific plans,
mindlessly scrolling your phone.
What are you most likely to end up doing?

answers.text: Watch Netflix, read a book, or play a non-AI game
Browse YouTube for interesting videos about whatever
"Wonder what new AI tools are out there?" - start browsing
Watch AI tutorials or read about new features
Discover a new AI tool and spend 3 hours experimenting

questions.question:
You ask ChatGPT "Who won the last World Cup?"
and it responds with complete confidence, giving you specific details.
But something feels off - you think you remember differently.
What do you do?

answers.text: Immediately fact-check with 3+ reliable sources before believing anything
"Better double-check this" - quick Google search to verify
Trust it for casual conversation, verify for important stuff
"AI seems confident, probably right" - go with it
"If AI says so, it must be accurate" - complete trust

questions.question:
AI enthusiastically recommended a "highly-rated local burger place."
You went there and it was genuinely terrible -
overpriced, cold food, rude service. Your reaction?

answers.text: "Never trusting AI recommendations again" - back to doing my own research
"AI isn't perfect, I'll cross-reference next time" - lesson learned
"Bad luck this time, but usually AI suggestions are decent"
"Maybe my taste is different? AI recommendations usually work"
"I must have misunderstood the recommendation somehow"

questions.question:
You're preparing a crucial presentation for your boss
and AI provided some impressive statistics.
If you're wrong, it could be really bad for your career.
What's your verification process?

answers.text: Check every single number against official sources - no exceptions
Verify the key statistics and main claims thoroughly
Spot-check the most important numbers
"AI data is usually pretty accurate" - minor verification only
"AI wouldn't give me wrong data for something this important"

questions.question:
Friends are debating whether AI will replace most human jobs soon.
Someone asks your opinion. What's your honest take?

answers.text: "AI is just a tool with clear limitations - humans are irreplaceable"
"Some jobs might change, but humans will always be needed"
"It's complicated - probably yes for some things, no for others"
"AI is already better than humans at many tasks"
"Absolutely! AI works 24/7 and doesn't make emotional decisions"

questions.question:
You casually mentioned a personal problem to an AI,
and it gave you incredibly insightful, helpful advice that really resonated.
Your reaction?

answers.text: "Lucky coincidence - it's just pattern matching"
"Interesting perspective, though I shouldn't read too much into it"
"Wow, AI is smarter than I thought" - starting to trust more
"AI really gets it! This is genuinely helpful"
"AI understands me better than I understand myself"

questions.question:
You asked AI for project ideas and got 10 solid suggestions.
Now you need to decide how to use them.
What's your typical approach?

answers.text: Take them all apart and rebuild everything my way
Pick 2-3 favorites and heavily modify them to fit my vision
Choose one good idea and make some personal adjustments
Find the most complete suggestion and polish it up
"Number 7 is perfect!" - implement exactly as suggested

questions.question:
When you need AI to help with something,
what's your typical request style?

answers.text: Super detailed instructions: "Write exactly this way, include these points, avoid that tone..."
Clear guidelines: "Here's what I need, with these requirements and preferences"
Basic direction: "Create something like this, focus on these main points"
Simple request: "Make me a good one"
Complete trust: "You know what I need!"

questions.question: Important deadline in 1 hour. AI delivered something that's about 70% of what you wanted - good enough to pass, but not perfect. Your move?

answers.text: "70% isn't good enough" - rewrite everything to 90%+ standard
Spend the full hour improving it to 80-85% quality
Quick fixes for the most obvious issues and submit
"This is pretty good" - minor tweaks and done
"70% from AI is better than anything I'd write!" - submit as-is

questions.question: Working on a group project where AI could help. What's your usual role with AI tools?

answers.text: "I'll review everything AI produces before we use it" - quality control
"Let's use AI for drafts, then we'll refine everything together"
"AI can handle some parts, we'll handle others" - balanced approach
"AI can do most of it, we'll just review and approve"
"Let AI handle everything, we'll just put our names on it"

questions.question:
What percentage quality does an AI output need to reach
before you're comfortable using it?

answers.text: 90%+ or I'm rewriting it myself
80% is good enough, not everything needs to be perfect
70% works fine - saves time even if not ideal
60% is great - way better than starting from scratch
50% is amazing - I'm grateful AI did anything at all!
